column9: Description
This parameter indicates the identification number  x of an axle. The identification number X starts with one from the front of the respective towed vehicle
This parameter indicates the identification number  Y of the tyre or wheel on axle X. The identification number Y starts with one from the left side of the respective towed vehicle
column10:
axle position X
wheel position Y = [1 to 15]

column9: vehicle identification number as specified in ISO 3779 (encoded as a string)

column3: for enums: allowed int or string?
column9: indicates if the towing vehicle supports the control of a drive system or retarder installed on the towed vehicle
This parameter requests the brake pressure for the parking brake as a percentage of the maximum pressure.
This parameter requests the brake pressure value of the service brake.
This parameter indicates the current status of the vehicle's service brake by observing the brake pressure.

This parameter indicates the absolute value of the actual speed of the vehicle (for example, positive values for forward and backward speeds) calculated as the average of the wheel speeds of one axle influenced by slip and filtered by a frequency range of 5 Hz to 20 Hz.
This parameter indicates the current status in all cases the retarder functionality is applied by the driver's demand or by other systems (e.g. brakes).
This parameter requests the torque of the retarder as a percentage of the retarder wheel torque reference.
This parameter indicates the sum of the static vertical loads of the vehicle axles.
This parameter indicates the actual pneumatic supply pressure of the reservoir of the braking system.
This parameter indicates the actual relative value of the brake lining of a specific brake. High values indicate new linings, small values indicate worn linings.
This parameter indicates the actual temperature of a specific brake.
This parameter indicates the actual tyre pressure of a specific wheel without any corrections.

column3: Is this per tyre or for all tyres?
column9: This parameter indicates the current status of the power supply of the tyre module. It indicates whether it is sufficient to achieve the specified performance of the module.

This parameter indicates the current status of the automatic towed vehicle braking. This function is active when the pneumatic supply is insufficient or not connected. This parameter should be used for driver information.

This parameter indicates the current status of the anti-lock braking function or system. The parameter is set active when the ABS starts to modulate the wheel brake pressure and is reset to passive when all wheels are in stable condition for a certain time period. The parameter can also be set active when driven wheels are in high slip (e.g. caused by the retarder).

This parameter indicates the current status of the ASR brake control function. ASR active indicates that the ASR function actually controls the wheel brake pressure at one or more wheels of the driven axles and does not indicate “installed” or “enabled”.

This parameter indicates the current status of the ASR engine control function. ASR active indicates that the ASR function tries to control the engine torque and does not indicate “installed” or “enabled”. This status is independent of other control commands influencing the engine torque (e.g. transmission control requests), which can have higher priority.

This parameter indicates the current status of the tyre pressure. An insufficient tyre pressure is indicated, if the pressure is outside of a pressure range recommended by the tyre or vehicle manufacturer, to ensure an optimized operation with regard to the fuel consumption of the vehicle and life time of the tyre.
This parameter indicates the current status of the brake linings. An insufficient brake lining status is indicated if the linings are worn out.

This parameter indicates the current status of the temperature of the brakes. A brake temperature out of range value is indicated if the brake temperature is higher than a specific level for proper operation.
This parameter indicates if a vehicle is a converter towed vehicle or a towing or towed vehicle.

This parameter indicates whether the loading ramp approach assistance is activated. The loading ramp approach assistance measures the distance to the loading ramp while reversing and applies the vehicle brakes accordingly.

column3: Shall it be possible to select axle pos?
column9: This parameter indicates the difference between the wheel speed on the right side and on the left side of the main axle, (wheel speed right - wheel speed left)
indicates the type of the vehicle

distance between the centre of the wheels at the same axle

total length of vehicle
This parameter requests to enable or disable the towed vehicle ROP system.
This parameter requests to enable or disable the towed vehicle YC system.

column3: Is this one or three signals?
column9:
This parameter is provided by any towed vehicle and indicates:
— if that vehicle is able to detect an additional towed vehicle (towed vehicle detection support);
— if an additional towed vehicle is detected (parameter “vehicle status”); and
— which type of brake system is detected in that vehicle (parameter “brake system type”).

This parameter indicates the current static vertical load on the driven axle of a vehicle. In case the vehicle is equipped with more than one driven axle, the value of the axle with the highest vertical load is transmitted.
This parameter indicates the position of the lift axle 1 or the load condition of the first tag axle. The numbering of the lift axles starts from the front axle position.
This parameter indicates the position of the lift axle 2 or the load condition of the second tag axle. The numbering of the lift axles starts from the front axle position.
This parameter indicates the position of the lift axle 3 or the load condition of the third tag axle. The numbering of the lift axles starts from the front axle position.
This parameter indicates the position of the lift axle 4 or the load condition of the fourth tag axle. The numbering of lift axles starts from the front axle position.
This parameter indicates the position of the lift axle 5 or the load condition of the fifth tag axle. The numbering of the lift axles starts from the front axle position.
This parameter indicates the current steering axle locking status.

column8: Parking and towed vehicle air pressure
column9: This parameter indicates the current pneumatic pressure on the circuit or reservoir for the parking brake and the towed vehicle supply.
This parameter indicates the pressure level of one specific tyre. This parameter is used in conjunction with the tyre/wheel identification.
column10:
EXTREME_OVER_PRESSURE
OVER_PRESSURE
NO_WARNING
UNDER_PRESSURE
EXTREME_UNDER_PRESSURE
ERROR
NOT_AVAILABLE

column9: This parameter indicates the current air leakage (pressure loss) of a tyre. This parameter is used in conjunction with the tyre/wheel identification.
This parameter indicates the current temperature of a tyre. This parameter is used in conjunction with the tyre/wheel identification.

column3: This seems more like a "service" than a signal? Trailer.Chassis.Axle.PosX.Load.Internal and Trailer.Chassis.Axle.PosX.Wheel.PosY can be used by a service to find it by tyre/wheel identification.
column9: This parameter indicates the static vertical load of a vehicle axle identified by a tyre/wheel identification

This parameter indicates the maximum allowed static vertical load on the driven axle of a vehicle. In case of the vehicle is equipped with more than one driven axle the value of the axle with the highest vertical load is transmitted.
This parameter indicates the fifth wheel load of a vehicle.
This parameter indicates the ambient air temperature.
This parameter indicates the current status of the parking brake. The purpose of this signal is to indicate to the towed vehicle that the parking brake in the towing vehicle is applied.

column3: "one or several vehicle axles identified by the tyre/wheel identification and axle load calibration data storage request" See comment above regarding service vs signal
column8: axle load measured by towed vehicle
column9: This parameter indicates the static vertical load, measured by the towed vehicle at the time of the axle load calibration, of one or several vehicle axles identified by the tyre/wheel identification and axle load calibration data storage request.

column3: "one or several vehicle axles identified by the tyre/wheel identification and axle load calibration data storage request" See comment above regarding service vs signal
column8: axle load measured by external scale
column9: This parameter indicates the static vertical load, measured by an external scale at the time of the axle load calibration, of one or several vehicle axles identified by the tyre/wheel identification and axle load calibration data storage request.

column8: axle load calibration data load level
column9: This parameter indicates the load case the calibration data belongs to. Each axle can be calibrated at one out of the three levels: heavy, medium and light load.

column8: distance between the coupling point and the middle of the first axle
column9: distance between the coupling point and the middle of the first axle

column8: nominal coupling height over ground for the first coupling point h1
column9: nominal coupling height over ground for the first coupling point h1

column8: nominal coupling height over ground for the second coupling point h2 for an unloaded vehicle;
column9: nominal coupling height over ground for the second coupling point h2 for an unloaded vehicle; this data is dynamic and indicates the current coupling point height

column8: height from the bottom most point of the chassis to the top most point of the vehicle at the front of the vehicle
column9: height from the bottom most point of the chassis to the top most point of the vehicle at the front of the vehicle

This signal shall command the request from a towed vehicle to the commercial vehicle to activate the amber warning signal, which indicates certain specified events within the braking equipment of the towed vehicle. A flashing warning signal can be used to signal fault conditions that are related to nonbraking systems, e.g. auxiliary equipment. It shall not be used to signal braking system-relevant faults or status.
This parameter requests the towing vehicle to activate the red warning signal, which indicates certain specified failures within the braking equipment of the towed vehicle.

column8: Electrical supply of non-braking systems status
column9: This parameter indicates the current status of the supply voltage of non-braking systems.
This parameter indicates, if the current status of the supply voltage is sufficient or insufficient for a proper braking function. This also includes overvoltage conditions.
This parameter indicates the actual lateral acceleration of the vehicle. A positive lateral acceleration value is used when the vehicle is accelerated to the left.
This parameter indicates the current status of the level change of the body height at the front axle due to any external control request.
This parameter indicates the current status of the level change of the body height at the rear axle due to any external control request.
This parameter indicates the current status of the level control function

This parameter indicates whether the loading ramp approach assistance is activated. The loading ramp approach assistance measures the distance to the loading ramp while reversing and applies the vehicle brakes accordingly.

column8: Nominal vehicle body level, front axle
column9: This parameter indicates the current nominal vehicle body height. In cases when controlled by “level change request, front axle” (see 6.4.8), this value represents the current vehicle body height at the front axle referred to ground level.

column8: Nominal vehicle body level, rear axle
column9: This parameter indicates the current nominal vehicle body height. In cases when controlled by “level change request, rear axle”
This parameter indicates the current state of the body height normal positions independent of a specific level request.
This parameter indicates the current body height position status of the vehicle as a response to the ride height request.
This parameter indicates if the current status of the pneumatic supply pressure of the reservoir of the braking system is insufficient or sufficient for a proper braking function.
This parameter indicates whether the ROP system is currently enabled or disabled.

column8: total height over ground of the vehicle at the rear of the vehicle, this refers to the rear end of the cargo put directly on the vehicle; this data is dynamic and indicates the current rear total height
column9: total height over ground of the vehicle at the rear of the vehicle, this refers to the rear end of the cargo put directly on the vehicle; this data is dynamic and indicates the current rear total height

column8: total height over ground at the front of the vehicle
column9: total height over ground at the front of the vehicle
This parameter indicates whether the YC system is currently enabled or disabled.
This parameter indicates the current status of the traction help function.

column8: height over ground for the floor inside the vehicle at the front end of the floor
column9: height over ground for the floor inside the vehicle at the front end of the floor

LUs include any kind of BAUs or BAU sub-parts with the capability to hoist goods, material, etc

The TLU comprises a mechanical device permanently installed on the rear of a commercial vehicle. It is
designed to facilitate the materials handling of goods from ground level or a loading dock to the level of the
vehicle bed, or vice versa.

column9:
HRUs control the temperature of the truck’s, semitrailer’s, or trailer’s cargo space. In case of vehicles
transporting containers with embedded HRUs, the HRUs are connected temporarily.
This parameter provides the sources of the measured parameters by means of the HRU compartment number
This parameter provides the temperature setpoint for HRU compartments
This parameter provides the return air temperature measured at evaporator input.
This parameter provides the supply air temperature measured at evaporator output
This parameter provides the temperature of the evaporator.
This parameter provides the ambient temperature measured by the HRU.
This parameter provides the status of the HRU. It includes the operating status.
